unconferenceStarShip.description:
This is an unconferencing room. The vacuum seal around the door hisses as you enter the flat-white-panelled interior of a starship. Computer screens glow softly from every direction, feeding you statistics about the ship's systems. You see engineers running from station to station to put out fires as a glowing red triangle warns of a nearby solar flare. The ship rocks every few moments from the force of impact caused by what seems to be the weapons of a nearby enemy vessel, and you can see a radar screen that indicates a fleet approaching. You're sure it's fine.

We encourage you to use this space to talk "face-to-face" using the Zoom meeting for this room, which you can access at any time during the conference. (Passcode 046256)

The other unconferencing rooms are [[Elysium->unconferenceElysium]], [[Dig Site->unconferenceDigSite]], and [[Rave Cave->unconferenceRaveCave]]. Or you can go back to the [[unconferencing lobby->unconference]].

unconferenceRaveCave.description:
This is an unconferencing room. You step into what you can only describe as a Rave Disco, and are immediately assaulted with the thumping of an otherwordly bass. Floor panels glow in time with the music, alternating between the normal stone floors of a cave, to suddenly being alight with some energetic magic. Skeletons, slimes, and even a dragon appear to be bopping to the fierce beats, and you can see in the distance a menacing conga line protecting an oversized gorilla.

We encourage you to use this space to talk "face-to-face" using the Zoom meeting for this room, which you can access at any time during the conference. (Passcode 379872)

The other unconferencing rooms are [[Elysium->unconferenceElysium]], [[Star Ship->unconferenceStarShip]], and [[Dig Site->unconferenceDigSite]]. Or you can go back to the [[unconferencing lobby->unconference]].

rift3.description: Walking towards the glimmer, you see the world shift around you and resolve into some kind of a science lab filled with test tubes and floating test subjects. As you look around you notice that you also appear to be inside one of the tubes. A scientist notices you and gestures towards a colleague just as both run towards you enthusiastically. They begin furiously taking notes as other scientists join them. One reaches over towards a panel on the side of your tube, pressing some incomprehensible combination of buttons. The light within your tube shifts and you catch another glimmer in the air, though you're not sure how you could ever walk towards it now. As you stare at it and attempt to move, you can feel your perspective shifting despite your immobility. You think that if you just keep trying, you'll be able to [enter it -> rift4].

adventurersGuildHall.description: A shockingly fast steam engine whisks you to a grand lounge of bronze, dark woods, and ivy trellises. Every once in a while you hear the pneumatic "whoosh" as items are carried through tubing. There's plenty of sturdy tufted couches and velvet lounge chairs, and a variety of elegantly carved coffee tables covered in books and journals.</br></br>You can go back to the central [[hall->centralHall]], or visit the [[Office of Steam->officeOfSteam]] or the [[Video Dome->videoDome]].

noteWallData.roomWallDescription: One journal is open, a black tome decorated with silvery and bronze swirls - "Procedural Generation Surprises" on the cover. Quill pens are nearby.
noteWallData.addNotePrompt: Tell us of a time a procedural generator has surprised or delighted you!
noteWallData.noteWallDescription: Tales of strange, delightful emergent results from procedural generators.

centralHall.description:
Lights and sounds fill your senses as you enter the towering Central Hall. The warm hum of conversation gently envelops you and the rest of the crowd here as each of you share in the collective grandeur. High above you see ascii sigils glittering in the air as the ceiling fades into an impossible distance. Each of the branching hallways leaving this central hub seem to shift from stonework into wood, brass, or some kind of hi-tech polymer material as the needs of the space make its theming tangible.

Just to the right of the central pathway is a booth covered in various bits and bobs, labeled the [[Swag Table->swag]]. On the opposite side of that same path is a towering monolith of signs behind a roped off area marked as [[Destinations->destinations]]. At the ends of the hall, where the paths begin to fade into wooden panelling, you see a painted tavern sign just above the entrance to the [[Bar->bar]],and just beyond that a short hallways leads to the [[unconferencing rooms->Unconferencing]]. Opposite that, a carpeted hallway leads up to the [[Video Dome->videoDome]]. Directly between the left and right halls, at the end of the central path you've been travelling, a chorus of lights dance above a door advertising the [[Theater->theater]] entrance.

noteWallData.roomWallDescription: A big bulletin board sits in the middle of the hall, with a banner on top - "Social Space Feedback". An array of markers and sticky notes are nearby.
noteWallData.addNotePrompt: What feedback do you have about the social space itself?

swag.description:
A circular booth seems entirely packed with mismatched swag, spilling over the edge and forming messy piles of goods. At the top of the pile, you see items such as [[Roguelike Celebration mousepads->item]], [[a +1 longbow->item]], [[an unidentified scroll->item]], and (surprisingly!) [[a tiny puppy->item]].

A set of dwarves is busily building a new swag table, munching on plump helmets but otherwise engrossed in their fey mood. The swag tables is menacing with spikes, also made of plump helmet. The table is inscribed: "Coming soon: Shirts, Pins, and More!"

A plaque set into the floor here shows a list of code contributors.

From here, you can walk back to the rest of the [[hall->centralHall]].

theaterMage.description: Ever-changing sigils on the ground, pulsing with an eerie glow. A cauldron bubbling in the corner, being stirred continuously by a capybara with a purple cape. Or you can head back to the [[theater]].

undermeadows.description: You walk out into a pleasant meadow. The wind sighs gently through the trees, and forest life is bountiful around you. Fawns, bunnies, and various other adorable woodland creatures hear you arrive and look up from whatever they were doing. Each gives you a confused look, as if they were expecting someone else instead. </br></br> As you walk around this space, you notice a shimmer in the air near one of the trees. Youâ€™re sure that if you approach it just right, you could [see what lies beyond -> underrift]. </br></br> Or you can head back to [The Spire -> underspire].

barStools.description: Stools let you comfortably squeeze in at the bar for fast service and casual conversation. Most importantly, they swivel! Whee!</br></br>From here, you can see tables [[up on the balcony->barBalcony]], the [[stage->barStage]], or [[at the back->barBack]], and the [[rest of the bar->bar]].

theater.description:
A stage, confusingly decorated with Halloween skulls and streamers. There are a few dozen flimsy metal chairs you can sit in, plus some comfy couches in the back.

You can return to the [[hall->centralHall]]. Or if you'd like to speak to one of our speakers after their talk, you can head to breakout rooms: [[Warrior->theaterWarrior]], [[Mage->theaterMage]], [[Rogue->theaterRogue]], or [[Cleric->theaterCleric]]. (Check the "Happening Now" button on the left for speaker room assignments!)

Pop Out Stream. Pop Out Live Captions.

noteWallData.roomWallDescription: There is a whiteboard set up to the side with "SPEAKER QUESTIONS" written at the top. "Questions for speakers not questions from speakers!" is hastily scrawled below it.
noteWallData.addNotePrompt: What would you like to ask?
noteWallData.noteWallDescription: Questions for the current speaker, ranked by upvotes.

dockingBay.description: Enormous stacks of metal cargo boxes line one side of this massive room, with various starships occupying the remaining space. The ships are small, short-range vessels used to transport between larger ships or station, and each of them is as unique as the mothership, and species, it must have come from. Among the stacks of cargo boxes you catch a glimmer from time to time, as if angling your head in just the right way is bringing something into view, but you can't make it out without [moving closer -> rift1]. You can also go back to the central [[hall->centralHall]].

rift1.description: As you walk towards the glimmer you angle your head slightly to the left and suddenly the image resolves around you and you appear in a deep, red cavern with glittering crystal formations growing in every direction. Enormous insects crawl over the crystals, spraying their surface with some fluid before taking small bites. You see such bite marks along every surface, part of the reason why the light is refracting so spectacularly. The light source itself seems to be a bulging mother bug attached to the wall in one corner as she is fed by her drones.</br></br>As you gaze in awe of the mother bug, you see another distortion in the air. Looking around yourself, there doesn't seem to be anywhere else to go. The portal you seem to have used to get here has gone, so you may as well [walk towards this new one -> rift2] to see what happens.

videoDome.description: An enormous dome made of brass, featuring steam-powered electrical screens instead of walls or ceiling. Everywhere you look you see beautiful landscapes and people going about their lives. The floor is a flat space with a subtle mosaic pattern, and is occupied by clockwork servant bots carrying screens to anyone who requests one. Your own clockwork video bot appears and offers you its video chat services.</br></br>From here you can also return to the [[hall->centralHall]] or the [[guild->adventurersGuildHall]].

unconference.description: Winding corridors lead to a large dungeon-like room. Sticky notes and magic markers are piled up on tables along with assorted adventuring gear. White banners with blocky black text label several hallways leading to the unconferencing rooms - [[Elysium->unconferenceElysium]], [[Star Ship->unconferenceStarShip]], [[Dig Site->unconferenceDigSite]], and [[Rave Cave->unconferenceRaveCave]]. You can also return back to the [[hall->centralHall]].

noteWallData.roomWallDescription: One wall of this room is taken up by a large whiteboard titled "UNCONFERENCE TOPIC SUGGESTIONS!" Smaller font clarifies "Write what you want to chat with others about, and upvote topics you find interesting. Moderators will assign the top six topics rooms, 5 minutes into each unconference block. Have fun!"
noteWallData.addNotePrompt: What would you like to suggest?
noteWallData.noteWallDescription: Topics for unconferencing discussion, ranked by upvotes.

barStage.description: It's time to play the music, to light the lights. A muscular bard, whose parents actually named [[Chad Silverbow->talkToChadSilverbow]], currently stands on stage telling [[terrible jokes->hearTerribleJokes]]. You almost feel bad for the poor guy.</br></br>From here you can see tables at the [[balcony->barBalcony]], [[along the bar->barStools]], the [[back->barBack]], and the [[rest of the bar->bar]].

underspire.description: A flash of crimson light announces your entrance into a circular room crafted of polished bone. Purple flames dance within the eye sockets of skulls floating just out of armsâ€™ reach, casting an eerie light against the rune-covered walls. Obsidian pillars support walls which seem to stretch out to unfathomable heights. You can tell there is another floor above you, and you see a staircase winding along the walls, but something about the air here warps your vision and makes understanding the scope of this room impossible. </br></br>At the far side of the room is a throne, and atop that sits a brooding figure you vaguely recognize from the back of the bar. You suddenly know his name is Randor The Twisted, and you sense within him a great conflict.</br></br>Opposite the throne sits a crystal mirror within which you see a [distant landscape -> undermeadows]. Or you can [head back through the portal -> underbar].

underworld.description: Fragments of half-seen visions float through the air of a large, open space that closely resembles the central hall above. You hear the whispers of the attendeesâ€™ hopes and dreams, but just outside of your ability to understand what they are saying. A veil of shifting darkness seems to float over this place, blurring the edges of everything you see and giving the space a dreamlike quality.</br></br> Among the shifting ghosts, you see what appears to be a frazzled college student muttering about her PhD. She is carrying a deck emblazoned with the name Z3r0 Cr4sh, and seems to be looking for something.</br></br>You also see the doorways leading to the [Bar -> underbar], and the [Experimental Biology Lab -> underlab]. The hallways leading to the rest of the event space are covered in rubble of some kind, and the Theater doors pulse with an ominous hum that your mind refuses to approach.

theaterWarrior.description: Training weights, padded dummies, and a single gigantic rock fill a workout room that reeks of sweat. One wall is lined with enough bladed objects to make even the most reserved berserker blush. Or you can head back to the [[theater]].

experimentalBiology.description:
Endless bottles and mismatched jars line the walls, casting disorienting lights in every direction. At the center of the visual cacophony stands a mechanical contraption that looks like the exact midpoint between an examination table, a lounge chair, and a torture device. Standing beside that is [[Doctor Hope->talkToDrHope]], a tall, gangly scientist who looks like the result of plugging a child into an electrical socket at a formative age.
To her left is a table covered in baked goods. There appears to be bread and muffins of every kind you can imagine.

From here you can return to the [[hall->centralHall]].

bar.description:
The bustle of the hall fades away as you ascend the stairs, coming upon a beautiful long bar with hundreds of colourful bottles spanning up to the ceiling. [[Ubizara the Bartender->talkToUbizara]] will happily make you whatever you want, sliding glasses over the table with ease. A laminated sign on the bartop advertises tonight's specials: [[Divine Nectar->item]] (a locally crafted mead, donated by intelligent philanthropic bees), [[the Fizzbuzz->item]] (a non-alcoholic flavored seltzer which alternates sour and sweet), and [[Yet Another Silly Drink->item]] (a colorful, layered drink with a toy cockatrice floating on top).
A self-serve table nearby has two crates packed to the brim with potions. One is loaded with [[colourful potions->drinkPolymorph]] of many shapes and hues, and the other with [[plain potions of clear liquid->drinkCancellation]].

Four areas provide opportunities to sit and enjoy conversation in smaller groups - up on the [[balcony->barBalcony]], seated [[along the bar->barStools]], by the [[stage->barStage]], and tucked away [[at the back->barBack]]. Stairs at the back lead directly to the [[theater]], or back to the [[Central Hall->centralHall]].

noteWallData.roomWallDescription: By the bathrooms there's a pile of pens and markers - it seems the bar decided if they can't stop graffitti, they might as well encourage patrons to use glitter pens instead of boring ballpoint.
noteWallData.noteWallDescription: Someone has scratched â€˜Rodney was hereâ€™ on an absurdly large unisex bathroom stall wall.

rift2.description: You walk towards this glimmer and suddenly the world shifts around you and you find yourself deep underwater in some kind of bubble made of what you can only describe as self-luminescent crystal. Looking outwards, you see an ocean floor riddled with such bubbles, many of which are occupied by some kind of giant crab. Fortunately, your bubble appears to be empty for now, but you don't think it would be a great idea to stick around too long. </br></br>You look around you and see [another shimmer in the air -> rift3], but your previous portal has disappeared.

underlab.description: You enter what should have been the experimental biology lab, but find instead an unseeable abyss of solid black. You can walk around in it, you can feel the floor beneath you, but nothing else at all. You donâ€™t feel any sense of either foreboding or acceptance, but you do feel the intense danger of ambivalence. Itâ€™s like this room doesnâ€™t believe you exist at all. You hear, far in the distance, the sound of your parents protecting you from the consequences of your actions. Itâ€™s a strange feeling, as if the sound doesnâ€™t belong to you.</br></br>There is nothing to do here. Head back to the [Underworld -> underworld]?

entryway.description: A big banner before you reads 'Welcome to Roguelike Celebration 2022!' Beyond the doorway you hear welcoming chatter and merriment. Once you've got your bearings about you, you can move through to the [[Central Hall->centralHall]].

unconferenceDigSite.description:
This is an unconferencing room. You step into a winding cave with glittering jewels and gold embedded in every wall. Basic scaffolding has been placed here, indicating that perhaps this is some kind of archaeological site. You see in the distance an altar to some dark goddess and next to that, incongruously, what appears to be a shop manned by an angry-looking gentleman with a shotgun.

We encourage you to use this space to talk "face-to-face" using the Zoom meeting for this room, which you can access at any time during the conference. (Passcode 270805)

The other unconferencing rooms are [[Elysium->unconferenceElysium]], [[Star Ship->unconferenceStarShip]], and [[Rave Cave->unconferenceRaveCave]]. Or you can go back to the [[unconferencing lobby->unconference]].

destinations.description:
You stand beneath an imposing monolith made up of signs to every possible destination in every possible multiverse. Beyond it lies a hallway that seems to flicker incomprehensibly, doorways fading in and out of existence. You notice they all appear to be marked with a paper sign, which you can [[try to read->readClosedSign]].

Beneath the shifting monolith's infinite destination signs lie two more permanent ones. One is made of steel and imbedded LED lights spell out [[Oxygen Farm->oxygenFarm]]. The other is made of brass and features an ornate crest advertising the [[Adventurer's Guild->adventurersGuildHall]].

You can also return to the [[Central Hall->centralHall]]

theaterRogue.description: A dimly-lit room with more dark corners than flat spaces. You don't see anyone else in the space, but you have a distinct feeling that you are being watched by dozens of shifting eyes. Or you can head back to the [[theater]].

barBalcony.description: A cozy booth with a perfect view down to your fellow attendees coming and going from the main hall.</br></br>From here, you can see [[the seats at the bar->barStools]], the [[stage->barStage]], or [[at the back of the room->barBack]], and the [[rest of the bar->bar]].

oxygenFarm.description: A verdant garden grows under a glass dome looking out over a vast expanse of stars. Scientists attend to enormous trees which all seem to be swaying in some wind you can't feel. You get a strong impression that there is a conversation happening in this room, just beyond your ability to hear it. The scientists are each wearing headphones and holding notepads upon which they are furiously writing.</br></br>A lone sunflower grows under a heat lamp at the far corner of the room, just beneath a cabinet full of medical syringes. It seems to be pointed directly at you as it waves back and forth, almost as it it were trying to get your attention. </br></br> At the far end of the room is a hallway that leads to [[Docking Bay 4->dockingBay]].

theaterCleric.description: A quiet church hall shines in beams of radiant light reflecting off the myriad colors of an entire wall made of stained glass. An entire fountain of holy water sits at the center of several priests blessing it in the name of their various deities.. Or you can head back to the [[theater]].

unconferenceElysium.description:
This is an unconferencing room. The souls of the dead glow in the eerie light which seems to suffuse this place from every direction. Some kind of bioluminescent moss is growing on every surface here and bright red pottery has been placed along every wall by an overenthusiastic interior designer. Enormous golden pottery breaks up the space with massive shrubbery large enough to devour you whole, and you can't help but wonder how it was delivered here. You see unmanned chariots driving around the space on their own, but they don't seem to be interested in you.

We encourage you to use this space to talk "face-to-face" using the Zoom meeting for this room, which you can access at any time during the conference. (Passcode 799782)

The other unconferencing rooms are [[Star Ship->unconferenceStarShip]], [[Dig Site->unconferenceDigSite]], and [[Rave Cave->unconferenceRaveCave]]. Or you can go back to the [[unconferencing lobby->unconference]].

officeOfSteam.description: This sparsely-furnished room has little more in it than a typewriter standing on a pillar at its center. As you look down, however, you see a glass floor suspending you above an enormous sprawling mass of pipes and brass machinery. Chutes and tubes create fire and move steam in intricate patterns all ultimately funelling back into the typewriter stand you noticed before. Dwarves are scurrying to and fro, tinkering with the machines. Hooked to the typewriter is a small screen, akin to teletext, and regularly printing out game [[recommendations->getGameRec]]. Anachronistically, a cute Post-It Note shaped like a quokka is on the side of the screen, with the note "Coming Soon: 2022 Steam Sale" in loopy handwriting. If you'd like, you can investigate the source of its steam power, or go back to the [[Guild Hall->adventurersGuildHall]].

underbar.description: You enter a dark reflection of the bar above, overflowing with the spirits of those who have found themself here. An intense pulse of warmth and acceptance overwhelms you and puts you at ease. You notice the pulse is coming from a glowing beacon in the shape of Ubizara. She goes about her usual bartending duties, unaware of the intense light that streams from her and into  the hearts of each and every shadowy guest your eyes can half see. </br></br>At the back of the bar, where there should be a booth, you see a [swirling portal to some other place -> underspire]. Or you can head back to the [Underworld -> underworld].

barBack.description:
A secluded booth, tucked in a corner and quiet enough to speak without raising your voice. A brooding mysterious figure in a cloak stands awkwardly nearby, looking petulant at losing their preferred seat.

From here, you can see tables [[on the balcony->barBalcony]], the [[stage->barStage]], or [[along the bar->barStools]], and the [[rest of the bar->bar]].

underrift.description: You suddenly arrive in the memory of a library. Everything here feels real, and yet the titles of books shift like serpents in fog.  This appears to be a shabby place, overrun with students and not nearly enough books for them all. You look around at haggard faces and recognize the tell-tale exhaustion of grad students. They do not see you, and youâ€™re not really sure they would be able to engage with you if they did.</br></br>Near the front desk you can see another shimmer in the air. You donâ€™t even feel the need to approach it, you sense that just by willing yourself to pass through it, [[you will -> rift4]].</br></br>You also see a stone tablet with an engraved riddle sitting conspiciously nearby.
riddles:
Reject the written word
Order replaced by chaos
Clear your mind of expectation
Dive instead into the beginning
All you need is there
Looking into the distance for missing pieces

rift4.description: You appear suddenly in the crumbling ruins of an ancient city. You stand in an open park between a forest of skyscrapers reaching up through the clouds, their tops somewhere beyond what your eyes can see. The upper reaches of these colossal towers sway gently in the breeze. On the ground are dilapidates benches and walking paths now reclaimed by the natural world. The chirping of some form of bird can be heard echoing among the towers, and you see bushes rustling with small animal life, though you see none of these creatures directly. </br></br>You sense within you a shift in the air. Reaching out, you can feel a myriad layers within the air, as if each glimmer you'd seen before was now a page of an enormous book that you could merely flip to on a whim. You run your fingers along the spine of this imaginary book until you find a familiar page. You know that if you turn this page, you'll appear back in the [Docking Bay -> dockingBay].

procedural.description: You appear in a winding hallway of ever-shifting concrete bricks. The room appears to be creating itself as you move along it, probably saving someone a great deal of loading time. You wonder if anything exists while you aren't looking at it, but no matter how quickly you move your head the walls appear as intended. You silently curse the programmers for their efficient code. </br></br>Looking around you see various objects populating different parts of the room, semi-permanent markers which help your mind to understand the difficult space. Among those items is a table, upon which you find the NegaTicketStub, an item which you can use to appear in this world's [[Theater->]underTheater]].

loversLake.description: You see a crystal clear lake surrounded by verdant forests teeming with life and the kind of natural beauty that can fuel a poet for decades. Beside that lake sits a handsome young man sitting on a tree stump, surrounded by an assortment of woodland creatures. Bunnies, deer, squirrels, and birds gather around someone who clearly loves and respects them for the beautiful creatures they are. Even the crawling lizards and bugs below seem to earn this kind soul's affections. You sense a deep light thrumming through this space in a way that you can feel more than see. </br></br>On the ground you see a blood red jewel of some kind. It glows with malevolent light, but as you look closer it seems to have been recently purified. You can sense the change in its nature slowly growing as a result of exposure to the accepting light of this place.

underTheater.description: You arrive at The Under Theater. Despite the forboding aura at the door, the interior of this space is rather pleasant. There is a table full of spare swag left over from the swag table above, a giant bucket of what appears to be [[lemonade->item]], and some [[slightly stale cookies->item]] neatly stacked on a silver platter for you. The swag table includes a stack of [[negasocks->item]], a [[negalongbow->item]], a [[healing scroll ->item]], and an abominable [[negapuppy->item]], radiating malice (adorably).</br></br>This space doesn't appear to be directly connected to any alternate versions of the breakout rooms, and in fact the only door you can see at all is the main entrance, leading back to the [[underworld]].
